Package com.intellij.execution.wsl

Class WSLUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.execution.wsl.WSLUtil

  • public class WSLUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for working with WSL after Fall Creators Update https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/commandline/2017/10/11/whats-new-in-wsl-in-windows-10-fall-creators-update/ - multiple linuxes - file system is unavailable form windows (for now at least)

      • addInputCloseListener

        @Deprecated
public static <T extends ProcessHandler> T addInputCloseListener(T processHandler)
        Deprecated. 
        Temporary hack method to fix WSL bug Must be invoked just before execution, see RUBY-20358

      • isSystemCompatible

        public static boolean isSystemCompatible()

      • getWindowsPath

        public static java.lang.String getWindowsPath(java.lang.String wslPath,
                                              java.lang.String mntRoot)
        Parameters:
        wslPath - a path in WSL file system, e.g. "/mnt/c/Users/file.txt" or "/c/Users/file.txt"
        mntRoot - a directory where fixed drives will be mounted. Default is "/mnt/" - WSLDistribution.DEFAULT_WSL_MNT_ROOT). See https://docs.microsoft.com/ru-ru/windows/wsl/wsl-config#configuration-options
        Returns:
        Windows-dependent path to the file, pointed by wslPath in WSL or null if the path is unmappable. For example, getWindowsPath("/mnt/c/Users/file.txt", "/mnt/") returns "C:\Users\file.txt"

      • getExistingUNCRoots

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> getExistingUNCRoots()
        Returns:
        list of existing UNC roots for known WSL distributions
